docs.title: Home
docs.text:
This is the official documentation for the filament-tournament-league-administration plugin for the Filament Admin Panel v2.x

The gihub repository is freely available to everyone under the MIT license.

images

The images in this documentation are all in English

docs.title: Calculation types
docs.text:
Currently there are two calculation types you can choose between. The calculation type is used to calculate the points for the points table.

The calculation type adds up the points as follows.

docs.title: Calculation table
docs.text: Calculation type Name Win Defeat Draw Pt. a. extension HDL Herner Dart Liga 3 0 1 no DSAB Deutscher Sportautomaten Bund 2 0 0 yes

docs.title: Points after overtime
docs.text: Calculation type Pt. a. extension Winner a. e. Loser a. e. HDL no DSAB yes 2 1

docs.title: Federations
docs.text:
Federations is at the top of the hirachie and is an association of several leagues.

Currently, the following attributes can be viewed or edited through the form.

docs.title: Attribute table
docs.text: Feld Typ Description Required Name Text input The name of the federation yes Slug Text input (readpnly) The slug is automatically generated from the name yes /automatically Kalkulationstyp Select Box The method of calculation according to which the games are calculated yes Upload File upload Here you can upload a picture to the association no

docs.title: Seasons & Tournaments | Federations
docs.text:
A federation can be created in the area Seasons & Tournaments | Federations via the button New Federation. By confirming the button New Federation you will get to the form input and after successful completion of the form you can create the federation by clicking the button Create or Create & create another.

Info

The form input options can be found in the above attribute table.

Create or Create & create another

A click on the Create button will take you directly to the edit page of the record after creation.

A click on Create & create another takes you back to the create federation form, where you can enter another record.

docs.title: Saisons & Turniere | Teams
docs.text: An association can be added in the Seasons & Tournaments | Teams section of the create or edit teams form. There is a plus icon to the right of the selection field for choosing a federation. This icon can also be used to create a federation.

docs.title: Edit federation
docs.text:
You can access the editing page of a federation via the listing table. Here you can select the desired record for editing and click on the edit icon. Clicking the edit icon will take you to the edit form.

Info

The form input options can be found in the above attribute table.

docs.title: View federation
docs.text: You can access the view page of a club via the listing table in the Seasons & Tournaments | Federations section. Here you can select the desired record to view and click on the view icon. When you click on the view icon, the record will be displayed in a dialog box.

docs.title: Delete federation
docs.text: You can delete individual records, a group of records or all records.

docs.title: About the listing table
docs.text: By default, you can delete assignments in the collection table as a whole. However, you can also delete individual records from your collection table by clicking the trash can icon.

docs.title: Via the editing form starting from the list table
docs.text:
You can access the editing page of a federation via the listing table. Here you have the possibility to remove the record by confirming the Delete button.

Danger

Each deletion process is only implemented after successful confirmation of the previously displayed confirmation prompt. If the confirmation prompt is cancelled, the deletion process is also not executed.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
This package is tailored for Filament Admin Panel v2.x.

Make sure you have installed the admin panel before you continue with the installation. You can check the documentation here

An event and tournament management plugin for the Filament Admin Panel v2.x, intended for dart clubs in the first implementation. Here you can manage clubs, teams, matches, players and match days including score tables.

docs.title: You can install the package via composer:
docs.text: composer require maggomann/filament-tournament-league-administration

docs.title: You can publish and run the migrations with:
docs.text:
php artisan filament-tournament-league-administration:install-with-addressable
php artisan migrate

or

php artisan vendor:publish --tag="filament-tournament-league-administration-migrations"
php artisan migrate

docs.title: Optionally, you can run the seeder with:
docs.text: php artisan db:seed --class=FilamentTournamentTableSeeder

<?php
return [

     * Buttons for text editor toolbar.
     */
'toolbar_buttons' => [
'attachFiles',
'blockquote',
'bold',
'bulletList',
'codeBlock',
'h2',
'h3',
'italic',
'link',
'orderedList',
'redo',

'undo',
],
/**
     *  Resources
     */
'resources' => [],
/**
     * Supported file upload classes:
     *      \Filament\Forms\Components\FileUpload::class
     *
     *      it supports this only in combination with:
     *          table_image_column => \Filament\Tables\Columns\ImageColumn

docs.title: .env
docs.text:
# for filament classes
MM_TABLE_IMAGE_COLUMN=\Filament\Tables\Columns\ImageColumn::class
MM_FORM_FILE_UPLOAD=\Filament\Forms\Components\FileUpload::class
# for spatie media library
MM_TABLE_IMAGE_COLUMN=\Filament\Tables\Columns\SpatieMediaLibraryImageColumn::class
MM_FORM_FILE_UPLOAD=\Filament\Forms\Components\SpatieMediaLibraryFileUpload::class

docs.title: file upload
docs.text:
You can use the two env variables to specify the classes you want to work with for file upload. By default, the package uses the filament classes for file upload and for displaying uploaded images. However, if you want to use the filament/spatie-laravel-media-library-plugin, you can do so and modify the env variables accordingly.

If you want to use the filament/spatie-laravel-media-library-plugin package that is already installed in the background, you need to publish the data and run the migration.

You must publish the migration to create the media table.

php artisan vendor:publish --provider="Spatie\MediaLibrary\MediaLibraryServiceProvider" --tag="migrations"

Run the migrations:

php artisan migrate

or publish the migration and migrate the table with

php artisan filament-tournament-league-administration:publish-media-plugin-and-migrate
